creator: gregm@bea.com
text:
In 1.6.1, with the removal of optional.jar in favour of the being broken up 
into 25+ jars, would it be possible to add all of these new jars to the 
manifest classpth of ant.jar?  I've done it and it works so far.

thanks

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
Well, the reason we broke everything up was so that you dont need to have
everything in the main ant lib; you could move classes that were in the
optional.jar into a new directory and load them separately. This lets you keep,
say, the junit tasks with junit.jar somewhere under SCM, rather than forcing
everyone to keep their version of ant up to date with all the libraries.

Would not adding all the jars to the manifest of ant.jar break that behaviour?

creator: markg@bea.com
text:
By splitting out all optional jars from ant.jar you have already achived your
goal:  "move ... into a new directory and load them separately".  For folks that
want the old behavior of configuring ant by adding ant.jar to the classpath,
putting in a MF Classpath entry to lib/*.jar makes that possible.  The MF
Classpath doesnt prevent your former goal, which achieving backwards
compatibility for previous behavior. Seems it would be the best of both worlds.
In the meanwhile we use a special Loader for starting Ant. That is collecting all jars ...
